column2: WA DRIVERS LICENSE TEST
column4: Washington
column6: WA

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. When they see a yellow X signal, drivers should:
column4: come to a complete stop at the marked stop line.
column6: prepare to leave the lane safely.
column8: turn off the ignition.

column2: 2. When you pass another vehicle, before you return to the right lane, you must:
column4: look at your interior rear-view mirror.
column6: make sure you can see the front bumper of the vehicle you passed.
column8: signal.

column2: 3. If your front wheels start to skid, the first thing you should do is:
column4: Take your foot off the gas pedal and shift to neutral.
column6: Immediately turn in the direction you want to go.
column8: Speed up, pump your brakes and steer in the direction the vehicle is trying to go.

column2: 4. Who has a greater risk of being involved in a traffic crash?
column4: Shift workers.
column6: Drivers who are driving alone.
column8: Young people.

column2: 5. Which shape is a yield sign?
column4: Vertical rectangle
column6: Upside-down triangle
column8: Pentagon

column2: 6. You ________ traffic headed toward you when you turn left.
column4: must not yield to
column6: must yield to
column8: must interrupt

column2: 7. Which of the following is NOT true about ABS?
column4: It improves the vehicle stability.
column6: It improves the steering ability.
column8: It helps increase your stopping distance.

column2: 8. If your gas pedal is stuck, you should:
column4: ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.
column6: hook your shoe under the pedal and see if you can free it. If not, shift into neutral and use the brake to slow your vehicle and get off the road.
column8: try pumping it to increase pressure.
column10: turn off the ignition if your vehicle has power steering.

column2: 9. This sign means:
column4: Vehicles may only turn left.
column6: The center lane is shared for left turns.
column8: Left turns in both directions of travel are not permitted.

column2: 10. When they see this sign, drivers should:
column4: slow down and keep well to the left.
column6: increase their speed and keep well to the right.
column8: not turn right.
column10: slow down and keep well to the right.

column2: 11. More than one vehicle is approaching a four-way stop sign. Who has the right of way?
column4: The driver on the left.
column6: The last driver to reach the intersection.
column8: No one.
column10: The first driver to reach the intersection and stop.

column2: 12. A solid yellow line to the right of a broken yellow center line means:
column4: vehicles may cross these lines when changing lanes.
column6: passing or crossing is prohibited in that lane, except when turning left.
column8: shared lane ahead.

column2: 13. A flashing yellow light means:
column4: Stop and look, then proceed through the intersection
column6: Speed up to clear the intersection as soon as possible
column8: Stop and wait for the green light
column10: Slow down and proceed with caution

column2: 14. When changing lanes, you should:
column4: check your mirrors, signal and change lanes.
column6: signal, change lanes and check your mirrors.
column8: signal, check your mirrors and blind spot in the direction you plan to move, then change lanes.

column2: 15. This sign tells drivers that:
column4: a divided highway is ahead.
column6: left and right turns are not allowed.
column8: they cannot go straight ahead.
column10: they must stop at the next intersection.

column2: 16. This sign indicates:
column4: a side road.
column6: a cross road.
column8: a no passing zone.

column2: 17. A steady red traffic light means:
column4: Stop. Don’t travel straight ahead until the light turns green.
column6: Stop, then proceed slowly through the intersection.
column8: Drive through the intersection with extreme caution.
column10: Slow down and yield to other traffic in the intersection, then proceed with caution.

column2: 18. It's 10 AM. This sign tells you that:
column4: you are not allowed to park here.
column6: you are allowed to park until 5:30 PM.
column8: you must display a special permit in order to park here.
column10: you must park your car between 8:30 AM and 5:30 PM.

column2: 19. This sign tells drivers:
column4: they must wait for the traffic signal to turn green before turning right or left.
column6: turning right on red is forbidden.
column8: they may not turn right or left during the red light.

column2: 20. Unless otherwise posted, the maximum speed limit on streets in cities and towns is:
column4: 30 MPH
column6: 40 MPH
column8: 25 MPH

column2: 21. This road sign means:
column4: Playground warning
column6: One Way
column8: Limited parking

column2: 22. To check your blind spot before changing lanes:
column4: look into the left side mirror.
column6: look into the right side mirror.
column8: look over your shoulder in the direction you plan to move.

column2: 23. When the driver behind you wants to pass, you should:
column4: slow down to allow room for the other driver to complete the pass safely.
column6: change lanes.
column8: use your brake lights.

column2: 24. What is a likely effect when you take another drug while you drink alcohol?
column4: The effects of alcohol are reduced by the drug.
column6: The effects of the alcohol and the drug are enhanced.
column8: There are no effects, unless the drug is prescription only.
column10: If the drug is over-the-counter, there are no effects.

column2: 25. A flashing red light means:
column4: Drive with caution.
column6: Go, but yield the right-of-way to other traffic at the intersection.
column8: The light will soon change to steady red.
column10: The same as a STOP sign.

column2: 26. This road sign means:
column4: Yield the right-of-way to oncoming vehicles
column6: Stop if necessary
column8: You must make a complete stop

column2: 27. To reduce their chances of colliding with an animal, drivers should:
column4: Slow down when approaching animals that are standing near the road.
column6: All of the above.
column8: look well down the road and far off to each side.
column10: scan the sides of the road to watch for the reflection of vehicle headlights in the eyes of animals.

column2: 28. Perception distance is:
column4: how far a vehicle travels, in ideal conditions, from the time the driver sees a hazard until his/her brain recognizes it.
column6: how far a drunk person can travel before coming to a complete stop in response to a hazard ahead.
column8: how long it takes a driver to physically hit the brakes.
column10: how far a driver will continue to travel, in ideal conditions; before he/she physically hits the brakes.

column2: 29. Are bicyclists required to obey traffic laws and signs?
column4: Not if they are licensed bicyclists.
column6: Yes.
column8: Yes, but only if they are riding in a bicycle lane.
column10: No, bicyclists are considered pedestrians when it comes to the rules of the road.

column2: 30. While inside the roundabout, you should:
column4: all of the above.
column6: use your left turn signal if you are in position to exit now.
column8: change lanes before you check for vehicles behind you.
column10: remain in your lane until you are ready to exit.

column2: 31. Drivers may need more space in front of their vehicle:
column4: All of the above.
column6: when following motorcycles.
column8: when it is hard to see ahead.
column10: when carrying a heavy load or pulling a trailer.

column2: 32. Alcohol:
column4: is a stimulant.
column6: improves your judgment.
column8: slows your reaction time.

column2: 33. What do warning signs mean?
column4: All of the above.
column6: Danger ahead.
column8: Drivers are approaching a hazardous location.
column10: Drivers are approaching a location where there is a special rule.

column2: 34. A flashing yellow light means:
column4: The light will soon change from green to red.
column6: Yield the right-of-way to other traffic at the intersection.
column8: Drive with caution.

column2: 35. This sign means:
column4: Drivers are coming to a point where another traffic lane joins the one they are on.
column6: A road crosses the main highway ahead.
column8: The divided highway on which drivers are traveling ends ahead.

column2: 36. What does a yellow arrow signal mean?
column4: Vehicles moving in all directions must stop if they can. The light will soon be red.
column6: The same as a green light.
column8: The same as the yellow light, but applies only to movement in the direction of the arrow.

column2: 37. This sign means:
column4: Double curve ahead.
column6: Road slippery when wet. Drive slowly.
column8: The road will curve to the right, then to the left.
column10: Winding road ahead. Drive with caution.

column2: 38. A driver cuts off another vehicle, or threatens another motorist or a pedestrian. These are examples of:
column4: defensive driving
column6: road rage
column8: furious driving

column2: 39. This road sign means:
column4: No right turn
column6: No U-turns
column8: Keep right

column2: 40. This road sign means:
column4: Winding road
column6: Multiple Turns
column8: Pedestrian Crossing
